title: Ayesha Altugle Figure :: How I Finally Found Her

media:group.media:title: Ayesha Altugle Figure :: How I Finally Found Her
media:group.media:description:
I tell the story of how I purchased this Atelier Ayesha figure from Japan, with the help of a small shop called JFigure.com who conducted the proxy bidding for me. 
(Please note that there is also another company called "JFigures" - it's easy to confuse the two!)

Please note that there are a large number of businesses specialising in handling auctions, purchases and forward shipping from Japan. Most of them, as far as I can make out, use highly automated services. Nothing wrong with that, of course, and they can obviously operate with somewhat lower charges than small, individual operators.
However, I really wanted a more personal service for a figure as important to me as Ayesha, so using the proxy service provided by a small shop like JFigure suited me better.

Time Stamps:
00:00 Intro
01:25 The shipping box
02:25 Background history and price development
05:00 Penguin Parade manufactured
06:50 Rant about eBay
09:25 Contact with JFigure
11:55 The auction process
13:50 Ayesha - the figure
16:25 Perspective on recent figure quality issues
17:25 Wrapping up - Details in Description below!

There is a highly detailed review of the Ayesha figure, with much background info, here:
https://neveroutgrewtoys.wordpress.com/2015/08/20/review-18-scale-ayesha-altugle-by-penguin-parade/
The Hidari artwork files were sourced here:
https://art.alphacoders.com/arts/view/95187
